item.title: Will Using Artificial Intelligence To Make Loans Trade One Kind Of Bias For Another?
item.description: March 31, 2017 - The next loan you get may depend less on your credit score and more on what a program thinks of your habits. Digital lenders say the process will be more fair, but others worry about unintended bias.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 31, 2017 - The next loan you get may depend less on your credit score and more on what a program thinks of your habits. Digital lenders say the process will be more fair, but others worry about unintended bias. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/31/521946210/will-using-artificial-intelligence-to-make-loans-trade-one-kind-of-bias-for-anot

item.title: How Can You Bring Innovation To Government Services? Follow Users
item.description: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jennifer Pahlka, founder and executive director of Code for America, about what it takes to bring innovation to government.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 30, 2017 - NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Jennifer Pahlka, founder and executive director of Code for America, about what it takes to bring innovation to government. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/30/522091613/how-can-you-bring-innovation-to-government-services-follow-users

item.title: Congress Votes To Roll Back FCC's Internet Privacy Protections
item.description: March 29, 2017 - Congress approved a measure that rolls back an FCC rule that would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - Congress approved a measure that rolls back an FCC rule that would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/29/521954026/congress-votes-to-roll-back-fccs-internet-privacy-protections

item.title: The U.S. Has An 'Active Cyber War Underway' To Thwart The North Korean Nuclear Threat
item.description: March 29, 2017 - New York Times reporter David Sanger talks about North Korea's nuclear program and warns that the regime, which has been "fodder for late night comedians for many many years," is no joke.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - New York Times reporter David Sanger talks about North Korea's nuclear program and warns that the regime, which has been "fodder for late night comedians for many many years," is no joke. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/29/521909787/the-u-s-has-an-active-cyber-war-underway-to-thwart-the-north-korean-nuclear-thre

item.title: Where Have All The Bob Seger Albums Gone?
item.description: March 29, 2017 - In the era of streaming music, everything ever recorded is supposed to be at our fingertips. So how did one of the biggest names in the Classic Rock canon go missing?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 29, 2017 - In the era of streaming music, everything ever recorded is supposed to be at our fingertips. So how did one of the biggest names in the Classic Rock canon go missing? http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/03/29/521642313/where-have-all-the-bob-seger-albums-gone

item.title: Run-Up To Census 2020 Raises Concerns Over Security And Politics
item.description: March 28, 2017 - Results from the U.S. Census in 2020 could remake the political map. Some census experts say the stakes for the upcoming national headcount are higher than normal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - Results from the U.S. Census in 2020 could remake the political map. Some census experts say the stakes for the upcoming national headcount are higher than normal. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/28/521789446/run-up-to-census-2020-raises-concerns-over-security-and-politics

item.title: As Congress Repeals Internet Privacy Rules, Putting Your Options In Perspective
item.description: March 28, 2017 - President Trump is expected to sign a bill to overturn new privacy rules for Internet service providers. An expert says there are steps you can take, though they won't deliver absolute privacy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - President Trump is expected to sign a bill to overturn new privacy rules for Internet service providers. An expert says there are steps you can take, though they won't deliver absolute privacy. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/28/521813464/as-congress-repeals-internet-privacy-rules-putting-your-options-in-perspective

item.title: Congress Overturns Internet Privacy Regulation
item.description: March 28, 2017 - The rule, which had not yet taken effect, would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data. President Trump is expected to sign the rollback.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - The rule, which had not yet taken effect, would have required Internet providers to ask permission before selling consumers' personal data. President Trump is expected to sign the rollback. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/28/521831393/congress-overturns-internet-privacy-regulation

item.title: 'The Tinder Opera' Creators Hope You Swipe Right On Online Opera
item.description: March 28, 2017 - "Connection Lost: The Tinder Opera" is an 11-minute video dramatizing a young man's quest for love via the popular dating app. It marks an effort to adapt a 400-year-old art form to modern media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - "Connection Lost: The Tinder Opera" is an 11-minute video dramatizing a young man's quest for love via the popular dating app. It marks an effort to adapt a 400-year-old art form to modern media. http://www.npr.org/sections/deceptivecadence/2017/03/28/521394763/the-tinder-opera-creators-hope-you-swipe-right-on-online-opera

item.title: Inside DARPA, The Pentagon Agency Whose Technology Has 'Changed the World'
item.description: March 28, 2017 - Journalist Sharon Weinberger discusses the Defense Advance Research Projects Agency, which develops innovative scientific technologies for the military. Her new book is The Imagineers of War.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - Journalist Sharon Weinberger discusses the Defense Advance Research Projects Agency, which develops innovative scientific technologies for the military. Her new book is The Imagineers of War. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/28/521779864/inside-darpa-the-pentagon-agency-whose-technology-has-changed-the-world

item.title: Older Workers Find Age Discrimination Built Right Into Some Job Websites
item.description: March 28, 2017 - The sites screen out older job seekers by limiting the dates you can fill in forms, an investigation by the Illinois attorney general found. But other sites say they make a point of fairness.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - The sites screen out older job seekers by limiting the dates you can fill in forms, an investigation by the Illinois attorney general found. But other sites say they make a point of fairness. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/28/521771515/older-workers-find-age-discrimination-built-right-into-some-job-sites

item.title: Elon Musk Seen Targeting Human-Computer Link In New Venture
item.description: March 28, 2017 - Speculation about Musk's new company, Neuralink, centers on the name and how it might correspond to his previous statements about incorporating artificial intelligence into human brains.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - Speculation about Musk's new company, Neuralink, centers on the name and how it might correspond to his previous statements about incorporating artificial intelligence into human brains. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/28/521763351/elon-musk-seen-targeting-human-computer-link-in-new-venture

item.title: Google Hopes To Hire More Black Engineers By Bringing Students To Silicon Valley
item.description: March 28, 2017 - Howard, the historically black university in Washington, D.C., is sending computer science students to study at Google's headquarters in California, as part of an effort called Howard West.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 28, 2017 - Howard, the historically black university in Washington, D.C., is sending computer science students to study at Google's headquarters in California, as part of an effort called Howard West. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/03/28/521737097/google-hopes-to-hire-more-black-engineers-by-bringing-students-to-silicon-valley

item.title: In China, As In The U.S., The Fight Over Ride Hailing Is Local
item.description: March 27, 2017 - Until recently, migrant workers lured by bonuses drove for China's largest Uber-like service. But some local governments banned out-of-town drivers, apparently to protect local jobs and curb growth.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 27, 2017 - Until recently, migrant workers lured by bonuses drove for China's largest Uber-like service. But some local governments banned out-of-town drivers, apparently to protect local jobs and curb growth. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/27/521650068/in-china-like-in-the-u-s-the-fight-over-ride-hailing-is-local

item.title: New USPS Service Gives You A Peek Into Your Mailbox Before You Get Home
item.description: March 27, 2017 - Remember when you were excited to see what's in the mail? These days it seems we're getting fewer letters and more junk, but the U.S. Postal Service will soon let you preview what's coming your way.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 27, 2017 - Remember when you were excited to see what's in the mail? These days it seems we're getting fewer letters and more junk, but the U.S. Postal Service will soon let you preview what's coming your way. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/03/27/521255204/new-usps-service-gives-you-a-peek-into-your-mailbox-before-you-get-home
